highlights: This beta introduces a much deeper plugin experience (with per-plugin settings and permission visibility), significantly improves tab/editor responsiveness, and ships a major stability pass across Carta runtime behavior.

features: Added a dedicated Sidebar settings tab with practical defaults for file tree sorting, search result sorting, default search expansion behavior, and folder pinning
Added a dedicated Plugin Settings dialog with per-plugin controls and generated setting fields (toggle, text, number, select, and action rows)
Added a capability-based plugin permissions panel that explains, in plain language, what each plugin can access or modify before you trust it
Reworked Settings > Plugins to show real official plugin entries with live enable toggles and one-click access to plugin-specific settings
Added Undo and Redo buttons directly to the editor top bar for quicker mouse-first editing
Expanded default Smart Replacements with a much larger conversion set, including legal symbols, additional fractions, arrow variants, and dash replacements
Added plugin dependency and compatibility-aware loading, so incompatible or missing dependency plugins are filtered before activation
Added a richer Restricted Mode explainer with expanded security guidance before enabling community plugins
improvements: Sidebar file tree sorting is now persisted as a default preference and can be adjusted directly from the idle sidebar header controls
Sidebar search result sorting is now persisted as a default preference and can be adjusted from search result controls without resetting between sessions
Search results can now default to collapsed or expanded based on your saved sidebar preference
Sidebar file tree sorting can now interleave folders and files by the active sort key when folder pinning is disabled
Idle sidebar layout is now more compact by removing redundant file-count status when not searching
Made tab switching substantially faster by keeping open tab content mounted in the background instead of remounting editors on every switch
Improved continuity when returning to tabs by preserving more editor/viewer state in inactive tabs
Scoped editor update handling to the active tab so hidden tabs do less background work and avoid focus/input interference
Reduced plugin-toggle jank across mounted tabs and improved responsiveness when changing plugin state
Improved Carta rendering efficiency by moving to dirty-subtree DOM updates instead of broader refreshes
Removed viewport virtualization paths that were causing edge-case instability and tightened incremental update behavior
Improved markdown reliability by normalizing tables during setup and isolating auto-convert state handling
Improved math refresh behavior so equation decorations recompute correctly when source visibility mode changes
Improved plugin lifecycle cleanup during editor replacement/teardown to reduce stale observers and callback noise
Resolved the Cmd/Ctrl+R reload-vs-refresh conflict so shortcut behavior is more consistent
Unified and polished several text-input/dialog flows (including trove creation and replacement-editing copy)
Removed vibrancy/transparency window wiring in favor of stable background rendering for cleaner cross-platform visuals
Hardened startup and action initialization sequencing so boot readiness progresses more reliably
developer: Migrated app-side Carta usage toward package-based @carta modules (core/react/view-dom/plugin-sdk/plugins-official) and reduced reliance on legacy local runtime internals
Replaced legacy public editor event-bus patterns with v2 transaction/lifecycle paths and cleaner host service boundaries
Introduced store-backed plugin settings APIs (typed reads/subscriptions, updatePluginSetting, updatePluginEnabled) and migrated legacy editor flags into plugin value storage
Migrated official extensions to the v2 defineExtension path with centralized extension compilation and manifest-driven metadata/settings handling
Added compatibility resolution for plugins (engine semver checks, dependency validation, duplicate detection, and dependency-order sorting)
Added host active-state controls so inactive editor/viewer surfaces can suspend unnecessary processing
Added startup profiling milestones with per-step timing output for settings/startup/shell/troves/files/actions
Refactored build/dev workflows into dedicated scripts and expanded --cartaLayout development flow
Pinned JavaScript Tauri package versions to match Rust crate minor versions for safer runtime alignment
Removed legacy Rust vibrancy setup and related module wiring

highlights: This release marks a major milestone for Plume, debuting the Carta editor with near-complete legacy feature parity, expanded formatting and extensibility, significantly improved spellcheck and text handling, and a sweeping pass of UI, dialog, and interaction polish across the app.

features: Introduced the Carta editor engine, a lightweight and extensible editor delivering improved performance, rich formatting capabilities, and full plugin support via an open third-party editor API

Expanded core editing capabilities with rich tables, blockquotes, horizontal rules, advanced emphasis styles (highlight, underline, superscript, subscript), smart quotes, improved autopairing for brackets and Markdown markers, and inline as well as block-level LaTeX math rendering
Implemented text replacement for converting common patterns into special symbols, including regex placeholder support for advanced replacement workflows
Rebuilt spellcheck using a lightweight dictionary-based system with support for personal dictionaries, ignored suggestions, and secondary suggestion results

Expanded navigation and productivity features with new shortcut cycling actions, a reorganized command palette, a shortcut for toggling developer tools, and dialogs that close when their shortcut is triggered again
Introduced a new "What’s New" dialog to surface key changes each release, alongside a refreshed changelog experience with clearer version messaging
Added support for trove subfolders, enabled editing of .txt files, and introduced a dedicated image viewer for image files
Added a boot animation to improve perceived startup feedback
Reworked sidebar search with exact per-file match counts, boolean operators, non-overlapping highlighted snippets, sortable results, and major performance gains via worker-based, streaming search
improvements: Removed the LLaMA-based spellcheck system to reduce application size and overall complexity
Resolved an issue where undoing immediately after opening a note could clear its contents, along with other edge cases that could lead to note data loss
Improved sidebar behavior and feedback, including a loading state while notes are fetched, expanded context menu actions, and native macOS menu usage
Refined editor context menus by adopting native menu implementations and expanding the available action set
Improved text and layout behavior across the app, including preventing title fading when space allows and limiting word and character counts to selected text only
Standardized dialog behavior and layout, ensuring dialogs initialize closed, use consistent sizing, restrict overflow scrolling to the vertical axis, and feature smoother open and close animations
Improved dialog ergonomics with better close button and icon sizing, unified focus outlines, and consistent interaction behavior
Removed hover animations, button transitions, and toggle mount animations in favor of instant, responsive feedback
Prevented onboarding flows from being fully obscured during transitions
Adopted the proper macOS traffic-light positioning API to eliminate window control flickering
Renamed "Experimental" settings to "Developer" with clearer descriptions and improved settings language throughout the app
Introduced an "Update Plume" section within General settings for improved update visibility
other: Theme support has been temporarily removed and will return in a future release
The legacy CodeMirror 6 editor engine has been fully retired in favor of the Carta editor engine

highlights: Introduces a new Keyboard Shortcut editor and an overall better user experience.

features: The Changelog dialog now fetches the latest release notes from a remote source
The Editor status bar now displays the word and character count for the current text selection
Added a new Shortcuts dialog to view and manage keyboard shortcuts
improvements: Onboarding flow now restricts the window size for better user experience
Improved the logic for grouping notes in the sidebar by date
Numerous minor UI adjustments, including standardizing icon sizing and polishing transition effects in the Sidebar and Tabs
Tabs now have a distinct visual style when being reordered
The type scale has been improved for better readability
Made the editor top bar act as a drag region to move the window
Added regex replace placeholders ($1, $2, etc.) to the search and replace modal
The default window size was increased from 900x800 to 1300x900
Made it possible to restart the onboarding flow from the menu bar or by keyboard shortcut
developer: The old "markdownHider" plugin has been deprecated and replaced with a new "richView" plugin
Significant refactoring to reorganize core logic, including moving Trove and editor plugin files into new, dedicated directories

highlights: Introduces a welcome experience for new users, makes trove discovery significantly faster, and improves the fullscreen experience.

features: New onboarding flow that guides new users through creating their first trove

Added "Default trove" setting to change the behavior of trove selection on startup

Better error handling when working with files and folders

Fixed a bug where syntax outside of fenced code blocks was not properly highlighted
Added a shortcut to change troves (⌥⌘O)
Fixed a bug where line numbers were incorrectly positioned when a line started with # and then immediately text without whitespace
Tab bar now animates smoothly in and out with height transitions
Transparency effects automatically disabled in fullscreen mode
App elements like the tab bar, sidebar, and editor now respect fullscreen mode

highlights: Introduces Troves, a portable folder-based system for organizing notes with attachments and metadata, alongside a redesigned editor navigation bar and a new reading view and source mode.

features: Notes are now stored in folders that contain .md files you can access directly

Reading view hides markdown syntax for easier reading

Files changed outside the app sync automatically with the editor
Better validation when renaming notes to prevent duplicates and invalid characters
Refresh from file command (Cmd/Ctrl+R) to reload notes from disk
improvements: Cleaner editor header with better navigation controls
Search now cleans markdown formatting for better matching
Auto-save happens faster and more reliably
Window transparency can be adjusted in settings
The Developer and Examples menubar tabs have been removed

Fixed a crash that occurs when no notes are open
Better handling of Enter and Backspace in markdown lists (experimental)
Setting to enable indent guides (experimental)

Editor top navigation includes reading/editing toggle, recent tab navigation, and additional controls
Source mode can be enabled from settings or the navigation dropdown to view raw Markdown
Links are highlighted; autolinks and masked links open with Cmd/Ctrl + click
New font set added
Settings and new note button are located at the bottom of the sidebar

improvements: Editor border is removed when both sidebar and tab bar are hidden
Sidebar note search now uses fuzzy finding
Closing the theme modal reopens the settings modal
Sidebar notes have a press animation
Settings sidebar buttons shrink on press
Zoom scaling improved, with horizontal scrolling when needed
Sidebar animates when toggled
Text selection and caret have been restyled
Find and replace modal now floats
New notes no longer include placeholder content
Sidebar notes feature a context menu instead of a dropdown
Base text size in the editor increased for improved legibility
Sidebar and tab bar toggling works correctly
Autoclosing behaves correctly when pairs are deleted and retyped
Ghost selection no longer appears on window blur
Traffic lights retain their position after window resize
Themes are properly applied on app launch

highlights: This update focuses on the appearance and visuals of Plume, introducing a new theme editor, revamped color system, enhanced find & replace functionality, and improved editor capabilities.

features: Added new theme editor to preview themes with live preview
Clickable preview indicator that opens theme editor directly
Remapped entire app to new color system with more granular tokens
Made the tab bar togglable (⌥⌘T)
Completely redesigned the find and replace UI
Added preserve case option in find & replace
Independent folding controls for headings and indented content
Dynamic reconfiguration of editor extensions without restart
improvements: Polished changelog UI with better spacing and typography
Enhanced find & replace with better keyboard shortcuts and navigation
Improved theme preview state management and cleanup
Better handling of editor fold state changes
